intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Sire, we have detected an enemy presence in the mountains. It seems there is a battle ongoing.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Alright. Jagen, Kris, let us hurry with our preparations!

intro.speaker: Wrys
intro.line: So I'm surrounded... How sad, I guess this is the end of the road for me...

intro.speaker: Clarisse
intro.line: Alright, he's right where we want him. Now to savor his pain as we slowly draw the life from his tormented soul...

intro.speaker: Katarina
intro.line: Clarisse... The Altean army has arrived.

intro.speaker: Clarisse
intro.line: Tsk! What a nuisance. Reese, I hate to admit it but you were right about this outcome. Alteans never abandon their comrades... You sure learned a lot about that trash from your time staying with them.

intro.speaker: Clarisse
intro.line: My job is to kill, one by one, everyone who sided with Marth in the previous war. Because if his allies live, they'll eventually join him, one after another. And that would be dangerous.

intro.speaker: Katarina
intro.line: ... Clarisse, are you really up for the task?

intro.speaker: Clarisse
intro.line: I don't need to get MY hands dirty, do I? My underlings can get the job done. We're hardly dealing with strong enemies.

intro.speaker: Katarina
intro.line: You'll die if you underestimate Kris and the others, Clarisse. I served as Kris's tactician, but I wasn't much help as one; I didn't give them the advice a tactician should give. Even without me, Kris and the others are strong.

intro.speaker: Clarisse
intro.line: What? Have you become attached to the Alteans after your little frolic with them? Then, just sit there and watch. Watch hard and well as I kill your beloved companions. Oh yes, and please... don't get in my way, okay?

battle.speaker: Clarisse
battle.line: Alright, I'm leaving the rest to you. Others are coming to help you soon, so hurry and kill them already. If by some chance those rats aren't dead when I return... I'll make sure YOU'RE dead, got it?

recruit-talk.speaker: Wrys
recruit-talk.line: Oh, my savior Kris. Thank you kindly for coming to my rescue. I cannot fight, but I can heal your wounded. Take me with you and you'll be very glad you did.

boss.speaker: Clarisse
boss.line: Wait... what? Where did you lot come from!?

boss.speaker: Clarisse
boss.line: Tsk! This is bad... To think I'd run from the likes of you... I'll remember this!

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Sire, are you unhurt?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Yes, I'm alright. Thank you, Kris.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: We've repelled the assassins, but we cannot afford to linger here.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I agree. I'm worried about Ogma. Let us hurry to Lord Wendell's place!

end.speaker: Clarisse
end.line: ...Hmm. The Alteans are better than I expected. Oh well. We can always snuff them out later. I'll let them live for now.

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: I warned you. The Altean army is strong...

end.speaker: Clarisse
end.line: Gosh, Reese. You can be annoying sometimes. Whose side are you supposed to be on? Don't tell me you're thinking of betraying Lady Eremiya?

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: ...No. That thought could never cross my mind. We all live for Lady Eremiya. For her sake, I must defeat Kris... I know that well enough.

end.speaker: Wrys
end.line: Greetings, Kris, my friend. It's been a while since we last had a decent conversation.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Yes. Ever since the knight training, eh, Father Wrys?

end.speaker: Wrys
end.line: Indeed, and you've become even stronger than you were then... ...Oh, did your hair grow a little?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Really? Well, it is true I haven't had the time to take care of it since we left Altea...

end.speaker: Wrys
end.line: You know, a haircut like mine is astonishingly easy to take care of.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: I-I can imagine...

end.speaker: Wrys
end.line: If you so wish, I could shave your head, so it's like mine.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Eh?

end.speaker: Wrys
end.line: As I'm a monk, I'm quite used to shaving heads. It's quite alright. If you don't like it, you can just let your hair grow and have your previous haircut back. What do you say? Would you allow me to shave your head?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Yes, please.

end.speaker: Wrys
end.line: Very well. Then, give me a moment to prepare. ...Are you really sure?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Y-yes...

end.speaker: Wrys
end.line: Then, please sit down. Now, close your eyes...

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: I-I think I'll pass.

end.speaker: Wrys
end.line: I see. It's a pity, but perhaps it's for the best. In any case, Kris, I'm counting on you from now on.
